intro: Schistogyne boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian schistogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Schistogyne boliviensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
